subject: Technology
title: Smartphone Addiction by Design
description: A quick, practical guide to Smartphone Addiction by Design.

hook.text: The average person checks their phone 96 times a day. That is once every ten waking minutes.

buildup.text: App designers use psychological tricks: red notification badges, infinite scroll, and variable rewards.

discovery.text: These techniques mirror slot machine mechanics. The uncertainty of what's next keeps you pulling to refresh.

twist.text: Former tech employees have spoken out, admitting they designed these features to be addictive on purpose.

climax.text: Screen time tools now exist, but they fight against billions of dollars of engagement engineering.

punchline.text: Your phone was designed to be hard to put down.

quiz.question: What technique do apps use to keep users engaged?
options: Limiting content to once per day
Variable rewards and infinite scroll, similar to slot machines
